description.plain:
Born December 8, 1982, Onika Tanya Maraj-Petty, better known by her stage name Nicki Minaj, is a Trinidadian-American rapper, actress, singer, songwriter, and entrepreneur.

Nicki was discovered by Lil Wayne via her mixtapes Sucka Free and Beam Me Up Scotty, and broke into the mainstream as an artist signed to Wayne’s label Young Money Entertainment. Her first successful songs, “Your Love,” “Moment 4 Life” (with Drake), and the smash-hit “Super Bass,” are featured on her 2010 chart-topping debut album Pink Friday.

She continued her run with her second studio album, Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded, which contained “Starships,” a song which would further develop Nicki’s pop/rap style. “Starships” gave Nicki a Billboard milestone, when it charted for 21 weeks in the top ten of the Billboard Hot 100, a feat no other artist has achieved without the aid of streaming services.

In between the releases of her second and third albums, Nicki starred as a judge on American Idol, and released a reissue of her second album in November 2012, filling it with ten new hip-hop tracks and promoting it throughout the following year.

On December 12, 2014, Nicki released her third studio album The Pinkprint. For this project, she abandoned her “Pop facade” and expanded not only on her ever-changing flows and thickened, denser delivery, but also on her subject matter and lyrical content. On the album, she delves into new depths with themes of vulnerability, relationship distress/abuse, betrayal, near-death experiences, motherhood, suicide attempts, drug addiction, abortion, murder, responsibility, female empowerment, sexual allegations, and entitlement. It is her longest-charting studio album to date, and housed numerous hit singles, including the pop culture phenomenon “Anaconda.”

Almost four years later, on August 10, 2018, Nicki released her fourth studio album, Queen. The album became Nicki’s most rap-oriented album to date, but also managed to incorporate R&B and Pop elements, much like Minaj’s previous effort. On Queen, Nicki defends her high position in the Hip-hop community, jabs at her top critics, reminds her listeners of her wealth and power, playfully disses her peers, and opens up about her recent love life, all in sixty-six minutes.

Nicki’s collaborations are also notable, particularly “Bang Bang” with Jessie J and Ariana Grande, the numerous collaborations with Young Money’s “Big Three” (Nicki, Lil Wayne, and Drake), and “Monster,” a collaboration with Kanye West, Jay-Z, and others, from Kanye West’s fifth album. Minaj’s verse on the song is praised by critics and is also known for sparking Nicki’s fan base. On May 1, 2020, Doja Cat recruited Nicki for their “Say So (Remix),”
which peaked at #1 on Billboard Hot 100 chart, and became the first collaboration between two female rappers to top the chart.

As of 2020, Nicki has charted 114 songs on the Billboard Hot 100, the most for a female artist and the fourth-most out of all artists. She has garnered ten Grammy award nominations and fourteen MTV Video Music Award nominations, winning five of the latter. She has 113 million RIAA certified units, comprised of mostly singles with 8.5 million albums sold.

description.plain:
On “Only,” the third single from The Pinkprint album, Nicki Minaj plays with her dominance over her male Young Money labelmates and asserts her sexual and rap prowess. Producers Dr. Luke and Cirkut provided the stripped-down beat, and duo R. City helped write the track.

“Only” marks the first time the Young Money figureheads all collaborated on a studio album track (not including the compilation album track “BedRock”) and also the first collaboration between Drake and Chris Brown since their altercation in 2012. Chris recorded an unofficial verse for the track during a radio freestyle a week after its official release.

songs.full_title: Feeling Myself by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Beyoncé)
songs.title: Feeling Myself

description.plain:
This highly anticipated song featuring Beyoncé celebrates the achievements of both moguls.

“Feeling Myself” could be viewed as the continuation of their acclaimed summer collaboration “Flawless (Remix)”.

https://twitter.com/NICKIMINAJ/status/539809808598454272

Hit-Boy (the song’s producer, who produced Jay Z and Kanye’s “Niggas in Paris”) broke down the song’s production on this video.



The official video was released on May 18, 2015 exclusively for Tidal subscribers, however it quickly leaked to the internet. The video features choreography from Parris Goebel, the then-23 year-old New Zealander who would blow up later in 2015 when she choreographed and directed the video for Justin Bieber’s “Sorry.”

songs.title: Barbie Dreams

description.plain:
On “Barbie Dreams,” Nicki pays homage to The Notorious B.I.G., delivering her take on his classic 1994 track “Just Playing (Dreams).”

Unlike Biggie, who rapped about his attraction to popular female R&B singers, Nicki decides to roast prominent male artists and athletes. It’s all in good fun, though, as most of the rappers Nicki puts down are friends and collaborators. A few of them are even featured on the album Queen, including Lil Wayne and Swae Lee.

Nicki previously used the “Just Playing (Dreams)” beat on her 2007 track “Dreams” from her mixtape, Playtime Is Over.

In an August 2018 episode of her Beats 1 Queen Radio show with Zane Lowe, Nicki broke down the track, saying:

Reading the reaction to ‘Barbie Dreams’ is hilarious. Everyone is saying how disrespectful [the song] is and that’s why I fucking love it. ‘Barbie Dreams’ is gonna go down in history. Shout outs to B.I.G. you are still inspiring rappers every day. This man is still inspiring me every day. He’s one of the first rappers who had a sense of humor. I love dope writers who can write bars and make you laugh. Eminem [after that] too. I think [humor] shows a person’s IQ and [wittiness].

songs.full_title: Truffle Butter by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Drake & Lil Wayne)
songs.title: Truffle Butter

description.plain:
“Truffle Butter” was released as an iTunes-exclusive track off of the deluxe version of Nicki Minaj’s fourth album, The Pinkprint, and features longtime collaborators and labelmates Drake and Lil Wayne.

Although the song’s title was originally thought to be related to a popular sexual term from 2015, it mostly references “truffle butter” as a symbol for luxury, with a few lines from Drake and Wayne pointing to the former.

The trio stunts about their lavish lives over a Nineteen85 beat that samples Maya Jane Coles' 2010 song “What They Say.” The song has been compared to the previous Young Money joint single “Only,” another cut from Nicki’s album.

songs.title: Chun-Li

description.plain:
Named after the first female character in the video game series Street Fighter (or any fighting game), “Chun-Li” was released alongside “Barbie Tingz” on the 12th of April, 2018, after Nicki Minaj’s 4 month hiatus from social media. The singles were the first songs from her fourth studio album Queen.

Throughout the song, Nicki compares herself to Chun-Li, a martial artist who seeks revenge for the death of her father, by saying she’s one of the first female rappers to dominate the rap game, and still dominates it despite her rivals' efforts to put her down.

Along with these comparisons, the cover art depicts her donning the same hairstyle as the character:



Chun-Li in Street Fighter V.


She also previously referenced both Street Fighter and the character in her verse on 2011’s “Fireball” by Willow Smith, where she raps:

Ok I’m the street fighter, call me Chun-Li

songs.full_title: Beez In The Trap by Nicki Minaj (Ft. 2 Chainz)
songs.title: Beez In The Trap

description.plain:
“Beez In The Trap” is the first song shared by Nicki Minaj and 2 Chainz and is taken from Minaj’s second studio album, Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded. The song marks the beginning of many collaborations between the two, such as “I Luv Dem Strippers”, “Realize”, and “Big Bank”. The track was released on May 29, 2012, and the official music video was released almost two months prior on April 6, 2012.

On the track, Nicki and 2 Chainz rap about “beez in the trap”, or being in a place where one can obtain drugs or money.

songs.title: Anaconda

description.plain:
Nicki goes big—literally—with a song about butts, sex, and more butts, backed by a “Baby Got Back” sample, nonetheless.

“Anaconda” is the 2nd single for and 12th track on Nicki Minaj’s third studio album, The Pinkprint, and it’s loaded to the brim with sexual innuendo.

The single’s artwork caused quite some controversy over the brazen imagery of her bare tuckus.

description.plain:
The new track by Nicki Minaj, taken from the second Young Money compilation album, Young Money: Rise of an Empire album.


Interestingly, the Chicago-based group Hotstylz released a song by this same name in 2007 (shouts to Mass Appeal for the tip)



Nicki has received a lot of negative comments for using a photo of Malcolm X for the unofficial cover of the track, something you can read more about here.



She referred to the controversy about the cover on a later track titled “Chi-Raq”, more specifically in this line.

songs.title: Super Bass

description.plain:
Originally released on April 5, 2011, as a Pink Friday deluxe edition cut, “Super Bass” quickly turned into a massive hit. On the song, Nicki raps about love and legitimate industry dudes.

Nicki described the song herself in this way:

“Super Bass” is about the boy that you are crushing over, […] And you kind of want to get your mack on, but you’re taking the playful approach.

In 2013, the song had sold eight million copies in the United States, and has yet to be updated. It was also Nicki’s highest charting solo single at the #3 spot in the US until “Anaconda” overthrew it in 2014.

songs.title: Barbie Tingz

description.plain:
In April of 2018, Nicki Minaj released “Barbie Tingz” alongside “Chun-Li,” as her first original solo music release since March of 2017, with “No Frauds,” “Changed It,” and “Regret In Your Tears”. Both songs mark Minaj’s return to music and return to social media after a four-month hiatus.

The single was announced along with its artwork on Minaj’s social media on April 10, 2018, and the official video was uploaded on May 4, 2018.

The song was teased as far as back to August 2017 when Nicki posted a response to a Cardi B tweet, with the hashtag “BarbieTingz.”



It was originally speculated that “Barbie Tingz” would not appear on Minaj’s fourth album Queen as it was not on the album’s tracklisting when it went up for pre-order. However, on August 12, 2018, Nicki confirmed that the track would be one of two tracks included on the Target exclusive version via an Instagram comment.

songs.full_title: Pills N Potions by Nicki Minaj
songs.title: Pills N Potions

description.plain:
“Pills N Potions” is a song by Nicki Minaj released as the first single from her third studio album The Pinkprint. The song has become one of the most successful from the album and further showcases Minaj’s skill for balancing two different genres on one song, in this case, Rap and R&B.

In the song, Minaj sings about the coping mechanisms she’s used, from illicit drugs to alcohol, to combat the pain she feels before a hard breakup is coming. The music video for the song features surrealistic imagery to show the confusion surrounding the current state of her relationship.

description.plain:
“High School” is a song by Nicki Minaj from the re-release of Minaj’s second studio album Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded – The Re-Up, which features guest vocals from Lil Wayne.

description.plain:
“All Things Go” is the opening track on Nicki Minaj’s third album. It was released as an instant-gratification download with the album’s preorder on iTunes.

She touches on her abortion, family, and relationship with SB. This song delves much deeper into Nicki’s family ties, which she explained in her recent Complex cover story.

songs.title: Starships

description.plain:
“Starships” is about defying expectations and realizing your potential—a lesson that’s very close to Nicki Minaj’s heart.

This track saw Nicki Minaj make her big transition from urban crossover rapper to mainstream pop songstress. With a little help from producer/songwriter RedOne, the baddest bitch takes her “Super Bass” success to the next level.

songs.title: Good Form

description.plain:
A week before the release of the songs “Chun-Li” and “Barbie Tingz”, Nicki Minaj appeared in a Mercedes-Benz commercial, and the hip-hop instrumental used in the commercial was later revealed to be this song according to a tweet by Nicki herself.

https://twitter.com/NICKIMINAJ/status/1025841969434509312

On November 4th, 2018, Nicki performed “Good Form” along with her Little Mix collaboration “Woman Like Me” at the 2018 MTV European Music Awards.

In October of 2018, the viral #GoodFormChallenge was started by Nicki herself to help promote the song. The challenge consisted of people sharing videos of themselves twerking or dancing to the song’s beat, something similar to many other viral-dancing challenges like the #KekeChallenge from “In My Feelings” or the #MannequinChallenge from “Black Beatles”.

https://twitter.com/NICKIMINAJ/status/1055958345692016641

Nicki released the “Good Form (Remix)” featuring Lil Wayne on November 27, 2018.

songs.title: Favorite

description.plain:
“Favorite” details how both Nicki and Jeremih are trapped in relationships where their partners are involved with other people. All they want is just to be the favorite one.

The song was co-written by Nicki’s then-boyfriend Meek Mill, among others. In an interview with Big Boy in December 2014, Nicki noted that Meek was originally supposed to be featured on “Favorite” but that he was unable to get on it in time as he was still in jail.

songs.full_title: Bed by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Ariana Grande)
songs.title: Bed

description.plain:
“Bed” is the second single released from Nicki Minaj’s fourth studio album, Queen. The song features longtime friend Ariana Grande, and enters their growing list of collaborations which includes “Bang Bang”, “Get on Your Knees”, “Side to Side” and “The Light Is Coming”.

Thematically, “Bed” is a request for companionship in the narrator’s bed, with lyrics alluding to increasing the sexual intimacy between two people.

Nicki revealed the single title and artwork on June 11, 2018, through Instagram and through a tweet, alongside with the drop of her other buzz single “Rich Sex”, featuring Lil Wayne:
https://twitter.com/NICKIMINAJ/status/1006201132752891905

A music video for the song was released on July 6, 2018.

songs.title: Ganja Burn

description.plain:
On “Ganja Burn,” Nicki calls out the competition. She reminds them that they’re nothing. They can never top her successful, long lasting career.

The music video—directed by Mert Alas and Marcus Piggott—matches the same theme of the Queen album cover. It features Egyptian attire, African dancers, and a desert setting.

Fans have speculated that much of the lyrics is aimed at New York rapper Cardi B, though neither Nicki or Cardi has confirmed it.

The lyrics printed on the Queen merchandise are quoted from the track.

songs.full_title: Chiraq by Nicki Minaj (Ft. G Herbo)
songs.title: Chiraq

description.plain:
Chiraq is a slang term for Chicago due to its violence, and because it had a comparable murder rate between 2003 and 2011 than Iraq. Although Nicki isn’t from Chicago this song has spawned hundreds of remixes from Chicago rappers and others, notable ones being from Montana of 300’s freestyle, Meek Mill’s rendition and Young M.A’s version.



Nicki’s verse as a whole is super fierce, and feeds off talking shit while Nicki Minaj approaches a lot of issues that have been stewing from the previous year and her recently released songs. In her verse, she mentions the “Looking Ass Nigga” controversy (inadvertently people got upset, as she expected, since they didn’t get the main point of the song).

This Complex article pieces the deeper context of Nicki Minaj and the song here.

When Lil Herb heard that Nicki dropped the track he tweeted this:

https://twitter.com/LilHerbie_Ebk/statuses/453421502734401536

They both also posted this on Instagram:



Caption:

😩😩😩😍😍😍😍 I LOVE HA 😩😩😭

While Herb had stated, in an interview with Complex, that this song would appear on Minaj’s 2014 album The Pinkprint, it did not end up on the record.

songs.full_title: Want Some More by Nicki Minaj
songs.title: Want Some More

description.plain:
The seventh track off Nicki’s third LP, The Pinkprint, establishes the accomplishments of her career. She calls out her haters antagonistically: do they “want some more” of this pure talent that she is exuding?

The song was produced by Metro Boomin and features a sample of “True” by Spandau Ballet and “Dilemma” by Nelly.

songs.full_title: Bust Down Barbiana by Nicki Minaj
songs.title: Bust Down Barbiana

description.plain:
On February 6, 2019, Nicki Minaj released her remix of viral star Blueface’s biggest song to date, “Thotiana,” exclusively via audiomack. On the track, Nicki twists her words to fit the rhyme scheme with the word “Barbiana” while bragging about her wealth and rap skills.

This remix comes 4 days after Nicki dropped 2 freestyles, “Barbie Goin Bad” and “Barbie Drip,” via her Beats 1 radio station Queen Radio. Although she confirmed that she isn’t working on a mixtape since she has a tour coming up, Nicki did say that she might be releasing a freestyle every week on “Barbie Goin Bad.”

songs.full_title: I'm Legit by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Ciara)
songs.title: I’m Legit

description.plain:
“I’m Legit” is the 5th track off of Nicki Minaj’s Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded – The Re-Up. The song, produced by the duo Mel & Mus, sees Nicki recruit Ciara for the chorus.

The rapper talks about her newfound success after the release of Pink Friday, her body image, and the lust boys have for her.

songs.title: Yikes

description.plain:
“Yikes” is Nicki Minaj’s first track since her retirement announcement. The trap banger was first teased on February 3, 2020, following a three-month-long hiatus from social media and from the public.

On February 5, Nicki clarified that “Yikes” would not serve as the lead single to her highly-anticipated fifth studio album but that it would instead be released as a promotional single on February 7.

The release of the track was delayed by three hours, presumably because Nicki rewrote parts of the song to include jabs at ex-boyfriend Meek Mill with whom she had two public fights leading up to the song’s release.

description.plain:
In “The Crying Game,” Nicki and Jessie show off their vocal talent, singing and rapping about the difficult and emotional times after a breakup. The “game” that Nicki is playing is not fun, just watch the music video. As with many other songs from the album, this song might be about Nicki’s recent breakup with long-time boyfriend Safaree Samuels.

songs.title: LLC

songs.full_title: Bed of Lies by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Skylar Grey)
songs.title: Bed of Lies

description.plain:
Nicki Minaj introduced this single at the 2014 MTV Europe Music Awards.

This track finally addresses rumors regarding her previous boyfriend, Safaree “SB” Samuels.

Co-writer Skylar Grey, who wrote and sang the demo before Nicki Minaj got ahold of the song, said that one of her original verses ended up as the bridge but another verse she had written never came out. She revealed the lost verse to Genius during a 2016 interview:

Remember when you promised me the world? / You led me on, I let you in, you led me to your room / When you said forevermore / You pulled the sheets over my eyes, I feel so used

songs.title: Hard White

description.plain:
Leaked in April 2018 under the title, “Half Back,” the track was mysteriously made available on a Russian streaming service. The song was renamed and remastered to be featured on Queen.

During an interview with Zane Lowe, Nicki was asked about the track, and she stated that it was recorded early 2017 (late February – early March) during Paris Fashion Week probably, the same time “No Frauds” was recorded. This debunked the controversy about the song being targeted toward Cardi B.

On January 31st, 2019, Nicki announced “Hard White” to be the second promotional single off Queen, with the official music video dropping later that day.

songs.recording_location: Glenwood Place Studios, Burbank CA & Studio La Grande Armee, Paris, France

songs.full_title: Chun Swae by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Swae Lee)
songs.title: Chun Swae

description.plain:
Nicki teams up with American rapper Swae Lee, half of the duo Rae Sremmurd, and Atlanta-based record producer and beat-maker Metro Boomin for “Chun Swae,” a track on which Nicki and Swae take turns asserting their wealth and power. The track was first announced on August 9th, 2018 through Nicki’s Instagram, but was released a day later with the rest of Queen.

“Chun Swae” takes part of its name from Swae Lee, the feature on this track, and the other part from  Chun-Li, a character from the video game series Street Fighter. The tenth track on Queen, titled “Chun-Li”, also takes inspiration from this iconic video game character.

Swae Lee is known for his strange, high-pitched choruses, like on the songs “Black Beatles” and “No Flex Zone,” and the chorus for “Chun Swae” is no different.

songs.full_title: Get On Your Knees by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Ariana Grande)
songs.title: Get On Your Knees
songs.title_with_featured: Get On Your Knees (Ft. Ariana Grande)

description.plain:
“Get On Your Knees” features guest vocals from Ariana Grande and was produced by Dr. Luke and Cirkut.

The two artists have worked together before, collabing earlier in 2014 on Jessie J’s hit song “Bang Bang.” Now they’ll unite once again for Nicki’s third studio album. Both artist collaborated again on “Side to Side" from Dangerous Woman & “The Light Is Coming” which will take part on Ariana’s fourth studio album, Sweetener.

Co-written by Katy Perry, she revealed in her 2017 Witness release livestream that she was originally planned to feature on the track before Ariana joined it.



  


In addition to that it’s obvious that this song has 2 meanings:


Reversing the preeminence of males in Hip-Hop, who use the “mic” metaphorically, as a symbol of their patriarchy. Women can control the it for their own pleasure and gain now. It’s a representation of modern day, emasculation. Nicki has many songs, such as “Did It On ‘Em” on how the “mic” in her grasp is a potential symbol of women, presiding their presence in Hip-Hop. See pic below for an implicit example.

The dominatrix, in a relationship between a man and woman. With how the woman takes over dynamics of their sexuality, and asserts her power over him and demands compliance.

songs.full_title: Regret In Your Tears by Nicki Minaj
songs.title: Regret In Your Tears

description.plain:
“Regret in Your Tears” finds Minaj lamenting on a lost love, while finding hope in her own strength and self-confidence.

It’s the first track that she seemingly opens up on the end of her long-term relationship with Philly rapper Meek Mill.

Nicki teased the release of this track, along with “Changed It” and “No Frauds,” on her social media accounts mere hours before releasing them in the evening of March 9, 2017.

songs.title: MEGATRON

description.plain:
After a three month hiatus from social media and the public eye, except to attend the 2019 Met Gala and announce her Chris Brown feature, Nicki Minaj broke her silence by tweeting and writing on her Instagram story one word: “Megatron.” The cryptic message became the name of a promotional single for her currently untitled fifth studio album. “Megatron” was released on June 21, 2019.

Named after the sentient robotic alien creature from the Transformers media franchise, Megatron is known as the leader of the villainous group the Decepticons, and as the arch nemesis of Optimus Prime, the original protagonist of the series.



Megatron as he appears in the Transformers movies


This isn’t the first time Nicki has titled one of her singles after a villainous character. Back in April 2018, Nicki released the lead single “Chun-Li,” a song named after the first female character and “bad guy” from the video game series Street Fighter. “Chun-Li” was released alongside “Barbie Tingz,” a song which interestingly contains the line:

Uh, I’m in my prime, Optimus
Sagittarius, so you know I’m an optimist

Nicki first compared herself to the character Megatron on Future’s October 2018 track “Transformer:”

I’m still the bad guy, I am a Decepticon
Some call me Nicki but some call me Megatron
I’m stoppin' bags and I don’t need a red octagon

songs.title: I Lied

description.plain:
“I Lied” is a song by Nicki Minaj that serves as the second track from her third studio album The Pinkprint. The track produced by Mike Will Made It, a longtime collaborator of Nicki’s.

“I Lied” is a ballad that contains a torpid production with little to no tempo change. Lyrically, the song revolves around a “complicated regret” in which Minaj admits she denied her love for a man in order to stop him from breaking her heart.

According to Billboard:

Her vocals speak volumes about her range more than any former ballad. This hauntingly hollow record recalls her unwillingness to “let herself go” in attempt to keep her heart intact.

songs.full_title: Big Daddy by Nicki Minaj (Ft. Meek Mill)
songs.title: Big Daddy

description.plain:
“Big Daddy” is the seventeenth track on Nicki Minaj’s third studio album, The Pinkprint. “Big Daddy” features artist Meek Mill, who was also featured on “Buy A Heart”, another track from The Pinkprint. The song was first released on Power 99FM, a radio station from Meek’s hometown of Philadelphia.

Meek has teased his pieces of the track several times, hinting that this song may have been originally for his album Dreams Worth More Than Money.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v44wnWQfbdw

songs.title: Roman Holiday

description.plain:
When Nicki Minaj first showed the world “Roman Holiday”, it was during her performance at the 54th annual Grammy Awards Ceremony on February 12, 2012. The performance received a multitude of mixed reviews from critics, who often described it with words like “demonic,” “theatrical,“ and “outraging.” The Exorcism of Roman, the name for Nicki’s performance, became one of the most controversial performances of recent years. After the show, Nicki spoke with Ryan Seacrest and told him that the Grammys asked for her to perform the song and that:

It was the most comfortable I have ever felt on stage in my entire life

Laurieann Gibson, a choreographer from performance, spoke with MTV News and said:

I was super-proud about the execution and really excited about how well Nicki performed. I’ve worked with Nicki before. When she was first starting I did an MTV performance. She is just so unique. For me, it was about the theatrical aspect of being able to create something like that. It’s about always inspiring people and extract that negative from them and believe in what they can do and empower themselves in a positive way and not be afraid to look at those things that are evil. The inspiration and the fight in the choreography, in the creative, is bold because when you believe in yourself and you believe in the good, you come from a bold place. You’re not intimidated any longer by the evil.

For the performance, Nicki had many restrictions, including rules against having crosses and using praying hands (this rule was eventually broken at the very beginning of the performance). Gibson, the choreography from earlier, added:

The innocence and the purity of just being bold, about the fight and no fear—–there wasn’t anything negative there

On February 18, Waka Flocka Flame, a fellow rapper and friend of Minaj, expressed frustration against the rumors that Minaj’s performance had ties with The Illuminati or to Satanic (devil worshipping) cults.

description.plain:
Lunchmoney Lewis gives Nicki an assist on this uptempo, Trinidadian-inspired joint. Minaj was born in St. James, Trinidad and Tobago, before growing up in Queens, NYC.

Nicki showcases her love of sexual innuendoes and gives us a history lesson on Caribbean dance moves.

songs.full_title: The Pinkprint Freestyle by Nicki Minaj
songs.title: The Pinkprint Freestyle

description.plain:
Nicki Minaj has been toying with the idea of releasing a new mixtape since she dropped The Pinkprint album back in 2014. While she has thrown out a few guest verses here and there, “The Pinkprint Freestyle” is the first solo track we’ve heard from her in quite some time.

On her new six minute freestyle, Nicki spits two verses over Young M.A’s “OOOUUU” before the track switches and she interpolates M.I.A.’s “Paper Planes” over an Emperor Ranks sample.

songs.title: Grand Piano

description.plain:
“Grand Piano” is the sixteenth track and the standard album’s closing track from Nicki Minaj’s third studio album, The Pinkprint.

“Grand Piano” sees Nicki comparing her heartbreak to the sad tunes of a piano. Her man is cold-hearted and is hurting her emotionally, but she wants him to continue to “play her heart” because she hopes to keep him a little longer.

Nicki noted that this song is one of the album’s most emotional songs:

https://twitter.com/NICKIMINAJ/status/539802244271857664

The crying violin is sampled from Paula Abdul’s “Rush Rush”.

annotatable.title: Grand Piano

body.plain:
“Grand Piano” is the sixteenth track and the standard album’s closing track from Nicki Minaj’s third studio album, The Pinkprint.

“Grand Piano” sees Nicki comparing her heartbreak to the sad tunes of a piano. Her man is cold-hearted and is hurting her emotionally, but she wants him to continue to “play her heart” because she hopes to keep him a little longer.

Nicki noted that this song is one of the album’s most emotional songs:

https://twitter.com/NICKIMINAJ/status/539802244271857664

The crying violin is sampled from Paula Abdul’s “Rush Rush”.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Am I just a fool?
Blind and stupid for lovin' you
Am I just a silly girl?
So young and naive to think you were...

[Pre-Chorus]
The one who came to take claim of this heart
Cold-hearted, shame you'll remain just a frame in the dark

[Chorus]
(And now the people) The people are talkin'
The people are sayin' that you have been playin' my heart
Like a grand piano (Piano)
The people are talkin'

Like a grand piano (Piano)

So play on, play on, play on
